evidences.masked_sentence: Lind Ridge (75°48′S132°33′W﻿ / ﻿75.800°S 132.550°W) is a ridge forming the south wall of Coleman Glacier in the Ames Range of Marie Byrd Land, [MASK].

It was mapped from Australian National Antarctic Research Expeditions surveys and air photos, 1955–65, and named by the [MASK] Names Committee of Australia for M.J. Corry, a surveyor at Mawson Station in 1965.

Corry Massif (70°27′S64°36′E﻿ / ﻿70.450°S 64.600°E) is a large massif marked by an unusual moraine pattern on the north side, standing 3 nautical miles (6 km) west-northwest of Crohn Massif in the Porthos Range of the Prince Charles Mountains in [MASK].

It was mapped from Australian National [MASK] Research Expeditions surveys and air photos, 1955–65, and named by the Antarctic Names Committee of Australia for M.J. Corry, a surveyor at Mawson Station in 1965.

It was named by the Advisory Committee on [MASK] Names for Lieutenant William D. Fordell, U.S. Navy, a co-pilot of LC-47 aircraft, who perished in a plane crash on the Ross Ice Shelf on February 2, 1966.
Mount Fordell (80°19′S82°9′W﻿ / ﻿80.317°S 82.150°W) is a mountain, 1,670 metres (5,480 ft) high, marking the south end of the Marble Hills in the Heritage Range, [MASK].
Cape Danger is the rocky point forming the northwest extremity of the ice-free Desolation Island situated in the entrance to Hero Bay, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

The peak was named by US-ACAN in 2006 after Richard W. Wahlstrom, member of the 1966–67 American Antarctic Mountaineering Expedition that made the first ascent of Mount Vinson, the summit of [MASK], and other high mountains in the Sentinel Range.
Wahlstrom Peak is a 4,677 metres (15,344 ft) high, sharp peak at the southeast side of the ice-covered Vinson Plateau in the Sentinel Range of the Ellsworth Mountains, [MASK].

The peak was named by US-ACAN in 2006 after Richard W. Wahlstrom, member of the 1966–67 American [MASK] Mountaineering Expedition that made the first ascent of Mount Vinson, the summit of Antarctica, and other high mountains in the Sentinel Range.

Hermes Point (73°35′S166°13′E﻿ / ﻿73.583°S 166.217°E) is the seaward end of a ridge from the Mountaineer Range, situated at the confluence of Icebreaker Glacier and Fitzgerald Glacier along the coast of Victoria Land, [MASK].

It was mapped by the United States Geological Survey from surveys and U.S. Navy air photos 1960–64, and was named by the Advisory Committee on [MASK] Names for Agustive A. Hermes, Jr., U.S. Navy, an aviation structural mechanic at Williams Field, McMurdo Sound, on U.S. Navy Operation Deep Freeze, 1967 and 1968.
Börgen Bay (64°45′S63°30′W﻿ / ﻿64.750°S 63.500°W) is a bay 4 nautical miles (7 km) wide, indenting the southeast coast of Anvers Island close west of Bay Point, in the Palmer Archipelago of [MASK].

The Mirounga Flats (60°42′S45°36′W﻿ / ﻿60.700°S 45.600°W) are a small partially enclosed tidal area in the inner, northwestern corner of Borge Bay, Signy Island, in the South Orkney Islands off [MASK].
The Marble Knolls (60°42′S45°37′W﻿ / ﻿60.700°S 45.617°W) are low marble knolls which lie near the shore of Borge Bay, just southwest of Waterpipe Beach, in eastern Signy Island, [MASK].

Named by the United Kingdom [MASK] Place-Names Committee (UK-APC) for the Norwegian transport Orwell, the second ship of that name belonging to the Tonsberg Hvalfangeri, which anchored in Borge Bay, Signy Island, on the west side of this bight in the seasons 1925-26 to 1929-30.

The Thule Islands (60°42′S45°37′W﻿ / ﻿60.700°S 45.617°W) are a group of small islands and rocks lying 0.25 nautical miles (0.5 km) southwest of Balin Point in the northwestern part of Borge Bay, Signy Island, in the South Orkney Islands off [MASK].
Named by Advisory Committee on [MASK] Names (US-ACAN) for Grosvenor S. Wotkyns, hospital corpsman at Byrd Station in 1962.

It was mapped by the United States Geological Survey from surveys and U.S. Navy air photos, 1960–64, and was named by the Advisory Committee on [MASK] Names for Paul E. Linn, U.S. Navy, a utilitiesman at McMurdo Station in 1963 and 1967.
Linn Mesa (73°32′S163°20′E﻿ / ﻿73.533°S 163.333°E) is a small mesa located 3 nautical miles (6 km) south of the Chisholm Hills in the Southern Cross Mountains of Victoria Land, [MASK].
Mount Howell (72°14′S99°3′W﻿ / ﻿72.233°S 99.050°W) is a mountain 3 nautical miles (6 km) south-southwest of Mount Borgeson in the Walker Mountains of Thurston Island, [MASK].
Intuition Peak on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] is named in appreciation of the role of scientific intuition for the advancement of human knowledge.

Phelps Promontory (62°28′55″S60°7′15″W﻿ / ﻿62.48194°S 60.12083°W) is a large ice piedmont promontory forming the north extremity of Varna Peninsula on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] north of Zhelyava Hill.

Dragon Beach (62°28′S60°8′W﻿ / ﻿62.467°S 60.133°W) is a broad gravel and bounder strewn area flanking Dragon Cove, and extending up to about 10 metres (33 ft) above sea level on Varna Peninsula, Livingston Island in [MASK].

This geographical feature was first mapped by the United States Geological Survey from surveys and U.S. Navy air photos, 1960–62, and was named by the Advisory Committee on [MASK] Names for Kaye R. Everett, a geologist at McMurdo Station, Hut Point Peninsula, Ross Island, 1967–68, and at Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands, 1968–69.
Half Moon Beach is a small crescent-shaped beach lying 1 nautical mile (2 km) south-east of Scarborough Castle on the north coast of Livingston Island, in the South Shetland Islands of [MASK].

Morton Cliff (62°28′S60°8′W﻿ / ﻿62.467°S 60.133°W) is a prominent sub-vertical rock cliff rising to about 35 metres (115 ft) above sea level, forming the western escarpment of Williams Point, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands off [MASK].

Among the products of the Centre is the 2009 Bulgarian topographic map of Livingston Island, Desolation Island, Half Moon Island, Greenwich Island, Aitcho Islands, Robert Island, Rugged Island, Snow Island and Smith Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Lister Cove is a 2.1 km wide cove indenting for 1.55 km the northeast coast of Varna Peninsula, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] south of Pomorie Point and north of Karavelova Point.
Burdick Peak is the summit of Burdick Ridge rising to 773 m southwest of Mount Bowles on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Bruix Cove is the 1.93 km wide cove indenting for 1.75 km the south coast of Moon Bay in eastern Livingston Island, the South Shetland Islands in [MASK].

Willan Nunatak is an ice-free tipped peak rising to 449 m on the glacial divide between Huntress Glacier and Balkan Snowfield on Hurd Peninsula in eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Yambol Peak on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] is named after Yambol[citation needed].
The 800-kilometre (500 mi) wide passage between Cape Horn and Livingston Island is the shortest crossing from [MASK] to any other landmass.
Amadok Point (Nos Amadok 'nos a-ma-'dok) is a point on the south coast of Livingston Island, [MASK] which projects 400 m into the Bransfield Strait.
Arbanasi Nunatak (Nunatak Arbanasi 'nu-na-tak ar-ba-'na-si) is a 320 m high rocky peak in Vidin Heights on Varna Peninsula, Livingston Island in [MASK].

Aleko Point (Nos Aleko 'nos a-'le-ko), also Aleko Rock, is a rocky point midway along the northeast [MASK] coast of Emona Anchorage in the east of Livingston Island, projecting 150m to the west of southwest.
Arda Peak (Vrah Arda 'vr&h 'ar-da) is located in the east of Livingston Island, [MASK].
Arkutino Beach (Bryag Arkutino 'bryag ar-'ku-ti-no) is a beach extending 1.8 km on the east coast of False Bay, Livingston Island, [MASK].
Asen Peak (Asenov Vrah a-'se-nov 'vr&h) is a peak in eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Asparuh Peak (Asparuhov Vrah as-pa-'ru-hov 'vr&h) is a peak situated on Livingston Island, [MASK].
Atanasoff Nunatak (Atanasov Nunatak a-ta-'na-sov 'nu-na-tak) is a nunatak, a sharp peak rising to 523 m in the east extremity of Bowles Ridge, Livingston Island, [MASK].
The Atlantic Club Ridge (Vrah Atlanticheski Klub 'vr&h a-tlan-'ti-che-ski 'klub) is a ridge rising to 161 m on Hurd Peninsula in Eastern Livingston Island, [MASK].
Bezmer Point (Nos Bezmer 'nos bez-'mer) is on the northwest coast of the Varna Peninsula on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Bowles West Peak (Vrah Zapaden Bowles 'vr&h 'za-pa-den 'bOls) is a peak rising to 678 m at the western extremity of Bowles Ridge in eastern Livingston Island in [MASK].

Boyana Glacier (Lednik Boyana 'led-nik bo-'ya-na) in Levski Ridge, Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands in [MASK] is situated southeast of Macy Glacier and west-southwest of Srebarna Glacier.
Academia Peak (Vrah Akademiya 'vr&h a-ka-'de-mi-ya) is a peak rising to approximately 1,130 m in the Friesland Ridge, Tangra Mountains, eastern Livingston Island, [MASK].
Canetti Peak (Vrah Kaneti 'vr&h ka-'ne-ti) is a 400 m peak in the Friesland Ridge, Tangra Mountains, eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Burgas Peninsula (Poluostrov Burgas po-lu-'os-trov bur-'gas) is a predominantly ice-covered peninsula forming the east extremity of Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] extending 10 km in the east-northeast direction towards Renier Point and 4.7 km wide.

Cherepish Ridge (Cherepishki Rid che-re-'pish-ki 'rid) is a narrow rocky 1.1 km ridge rising to 650 m. The ridge runs in the south to north direction from the north of Intuition Peak, in the Tangra Mountains of Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Chirpan Peak (Vrah Chirpan 'vr&h chir-'pan) is an ice covered 535 m peak forming the western extremity of Bowles Ridge on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] overlooking Perunika Glacier to the west and south.
Christoff Cliff (Hristov Kamak 'hris-tov 'ka-m&k) is a rocky cliff forming Aytos Point on the coast of Bransfield Strait, eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

The Debelt Glacier (Lednik Debelt 'led-nik 'de-belt) on Varna Peninsula, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] is situated southeast of Rose Valley Glacier and northeast of Panega Glacier.

Dimov Gate (Dimova Porta 'di-mo-va 'por-ta) is a 300 m wide ice-covered pass in [MASK], located in eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, Antarctica and bounded by Rayna Knyaginya Peak in Bowles Ridge to the southeast and by Hemus Peak to the northwest.

Dimov Gate (Dimova Porta 'di-mo-va 'por-ta) is a 300 m wide ice-covered pass in Antarctica, located in eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] and bounded by Rayna Knyaginya Peak in Bowles Ridge to the southeast and by Hemus Peak to the northwest.
Dobrich Knoll (Dobrichka Mogila 'do-brich-ka mo-'gi-la) rises to over 400 m in the middle of Veleka Ridge, Tangra Mountains, eastern Livingston Island in [MASK].

Elhovo Gap (Elhovska Sedlovina 'el-hov-ska se-dlo-vi-'na) is a 420 m high saddle extending 1 km (1 mi) in west-southwest–east-northeast direction from Gleaner Heights to Leslie Hill, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] which forms part of the overland route between Bowles Ridge and Vidin Heights.

Etar Snowfield (Bulgarian: Ледник Етър 'led-nik 'e-t&r, Lednik Etar) is a roughly crescent-shaped snowfield on western Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] situated west of Urdoviza, Medven and Berkovitsa Glaciers, and northwest of Verila Glacier.

Dospat Peak (Bulgarian: Vrah Dospat /'vr&h dos-'pat/) is a 500 m (1,600 ft) mountain peak in the Vidin Heights on Varna Peninsula, Livingston Island, part of the South Shetland Islands off the coast of [MASK].

Godech Nunatak (Godechki Nunatak go-'dech-ki 'nu-na-tak) is a rocky 410m peak in lower Huron Glacier, in the north foothills of Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands in [MASK].

Emona Anchorage (Zaliv Emona 'za-liv e-'mo-na) is a roughly square embayment, the internal part of South Bay, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] used as an anchorage for ships visiting the Bulgarian base St. Kliment Ohridski.
Ghiaurov Peak (Gyaurov Vrah gya-'u-rov 'vr&h) is a rocky 250 m peak in Delchev Ridge, Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Gurev Gap (Gureva Sedlovina 'gu-re-va se-dlo-vi-'na) is a flat ice-covered saddle of elevation 450 m extending 3 km in south-north direction between Hemus Peak and Gleaner Heights in eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Hesperides Hill (Halm Hesperides 'h&lm he-spe-'ri-des) is a ridge linked by a saddle of elevation 52 m with the northern slopes of Atlantic Club Ridge on Hurd Peninsula, eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Intuition Peak (Vrah Intuitsiya 'vr&h in-tu-'i-tsi-ya) is a sharp [MASK] peak of elevation 780 m in Levski Ridge, Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, Antarctica.
Intuition Peak (Vrah Intuitsiya 'vr&h in-tu-'i-tsi-ya) is a sharp Antarctic peak of elevation 780 m in Levski Ridge, Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Iskar Glacier (Iskarski Lednik 'is-k&r-ski 'led-nik) is a glacier in Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands in [MASK] situated southeast of lower Huron Glacier, west-southwest of Sopot Ice Piedmont, and north of Dobrudzha and Magura Glaciers.

Ioannes Paulus II Peninsula (Bulgarian: Полуостров Йоан Павел II Poluostrov Yoan Pavel II [poluˈɔstrov joˈan ˈpaveɫ fˈtɔri]) is an ice-covered peninsula on the north coast of Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] that is bounded by Hero Bay to the east and Barclay Bay to the west.

Kaliakra Glacier (Lednik Kaliakra 'led-nik ka-li-'a-kra) is a glacier in northeastern Livingston Island, [MASK] extending 7 km in east-west direction and 8 km in north-south direction, and situated southeast of Saedinenie Snowfield, southwest of Panega Glacier, north of Struma Glacier and upper Huron Glacier, and northeast of Perunika Glacier.
Kalofer Peak (Vrah Kalofer 'vr&h ka-'lo-fer) is a 300 m sharp rocky peak in the Levski Ridge, Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Kardam Buttress (Kardamov Rid kar-'da-mov 'rid) is a sloping buttress projecting 1 km northwards from St. Ivan Rilski Col into Huron Glacier on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK], and has precipitous and partly ice-free western slopes.
Karlovo Peak (Vrah Karlovo 'vr&h 'kar-lo-vo) is a 300 m peak in Delchev Ridge, Tangra Mountains on eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Karnobat Pass (Karnobatski Prohod kar-no-'bat-ski 'pro-hod) is a 220 m wide and 720 m high pass in Levski Ridge in Tangra Mountains, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Kamchiya Glacier (Lednik Kamchiya 'led-nik 'kam-chi-ya) is located on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] situated south of the glacial divide between the Drake Passage and Bransfield Strait, and south of Tundzha Glacier, west-southwest of Pimpirev Glacier and east of Verila Glacier.
Kazanlak Peak (Vrah Kazanlak 'vr&h ka-zan-'l&k) is a rocky peak rising to 430 m in Delchev Ridge of Tangra Mountains, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
600 m in Friesland Ridge, Tangra Mountains, eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Kavarna Cove (Zaliv Kavarna 'za-liv ka-'var-na) is a 2 km wide cove indenting for 1.2 km the south coast of Livingston Island (in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK]) that is entered between Elephant Point and Bond Point.

Kikish Crag (Vrah Kikish 'vr&h 'ki-kish) is a peak rising to 650 m in Friesland Ridge, Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] and is named after Kikish site in Vitosha Mountain, Bulgaria.

Karavelova Point or Nos Karavelova (/ˈnɒs kɑːrəˈvɛloʊvə/ is on the northeast coast of Varna Peninsula, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] forming the south side of the entrance to Lister Cove.
Kaloyan Nunatak rises to approximately 400 m in Delchev Ridge, Tangra Mountains, on eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Krichim Peak (Vrah Krichim 'vr&h 'kri-chim) is an ice covered peak of elevation 500 m in Vidin Heights on Varna Peninsula, Livingston Island, an island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Kotel Gap (Kotelska Sedlovina 'ko-tel-ska se-dlo-vi-'na) is a saddle of elevation 660 m extending 1 km between Serdica Peak and Silistra Knoll in Levski Ridge, Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Kubrat Knoll (Kubratova Mogila ku-'bra-to-va mo-'gi-la) is a rocky peak of elevation 140 m at the base of Inott Point, Varna Peninsula on eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Kresna Gully (Kresnenska Padina 'kre-snen-ska pa-'di-na) is a heavily crevassed depression in Perunika Glacier extending 2.25 km westwards from Rezen Knoll in eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Kuber Peak (Vrah Kuber 'vr&h 'ku-ber) is a 770 m peak in Delchev Ridge, Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Kotis Point (Nos Kotis 'nos 'ko-tis) is a point on the northwest coast of Varna Peninsula on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] forming the south side of the entrance to Eliseyna Cove.

Krakra Bluff (Rid Krakra 'rid 'kra-kra) is a rocky bluff of elevation 140 m surmounting Memorable Beach (62°38′35″S60°33′19″W﻿ / ﻿62.64306°S 60.55528°W) on the northwest coast of South Bay, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Komini Peak (Bulgarian: Vrah Komini 'vr&h ko-'mi-ni) is a peak with an elevation of 774 m (2,539 ft) on the north slopes of Levski Peak, in the Tangra Mountains, in Livingston Island, [MASK].

Leslie Gap (Sedlovina Leslie se-dlo-vi-'na 'les-li) is an 359m high ice-covered saddle extending 2.8 km in south-north direction between Leslie Hill and Radnevo Peak on Varna Peninsula in northeastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Kuzman Knoll (Kuzmanova Mogila 'kuz-ma-no-va mo-'gi-la) is a solitary ice-covered knoll rising to 620 m in eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Lom Peak (Vrah Lom [ˈvrəh ˈlom]) is a peak rising to 870 m in Friesland Ridge, Tangra Mountains, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] which overlooks Ruen Icefall to the north.

Levski Peak (Bulgarian: Връх Левски, Vrah Levski 'vr&h 'lev-ski) is a mountain in [MASK], rising to approximately 1,430 m (4,692 ft) in the western extremity of Levski Ridge, Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, Antarctica.

Levski Peak (Bulgarian: Връх Левски, Vrah Levski 'vr&h 'lev-ski) is a mountain in Antarctica, rising to approximately 1,430 m (4,692 ft) in the western extremity of Levski Ridge, Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Ludogorie Peak (Vrah Ludogorie 'vr&h lu-do-'go-ri-e) is a peak rising to 350 m in Friesland Ridge, Tangra Mountains in eastern Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands in [MASK].

Lozen Saddle (Lozenska Sedlovina 'lo-zen-ska se-dlo-vi-'na) is a 437 m high saddle situated between Lozen Nunatak and Zograf Peak in Tangra Mountains, eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] which provides overland access from the Wörner Gap area to the Shipka Valley.
Lyulin Peak (Vrah Lyulin 'vr&h lyu-'lin) is a sharp double peak forming the east extremity of Delchev Ridge and Tangra Mountains, eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Malyovitsa Crag (Malyovishki Kamak ma-'lyo-vish-ki 'ka-m&k) is a rocky peak rising to 290 m in the east extremity of Delchev Ridge, Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Magura Glacier (Lednik Magura 'led-nik ma-'gu-ra) on the southeast side of Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] is located to the north of M'Kean Point, northeast of Srebarna Glacier, south of Iskar Glacier and southwest of Dobrudzha Glacier.
Madara Peak (Vrah Madara 'vr&h 'ma-da-ra) is a 430 m peak in Vidin Heights on Varna Peninsula, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Medven Glacier (Lednik Medven 'led-nik 'med-ven) is a 2.5 km long and 1.5 km wide glacier on Ioannes Paulus II Peninsula, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] situated east of Etar Snowfield, south of Urdoviza Glacier and north of Berkovitsa Glacier.

Melnik Ridge (Melnishki Hrebet 'mel-nish-ki 'hre-bet) is a narrow ridge rising to 696 m in eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] bounded by Kaliakra Glacier to the north and west, and Struma Glacier to the south, and linked to Bowles Ridge by the 575 m high Yankov Gap.
Melnik Peak (Vrah Melnik 'vr&h 'mel-nik) is the 696 m summit of Melnik Ridge in eastern Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands in [MASK].
Maritsa Peak (Vrah Maritsa 'vr&h ma-'ri-tsa) rises to 560 m in eastern Bowles Ridge on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Mesta Peak (Vrah Mesta 'vr&h 'mes-ta) is a conspicuous, sharp and narrow rocky peak extending 500 m in east-west direction and rising to approximately 400 m in Delchev Ridge, Tangra Mountains, eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Miziya Peak (Vrah Miziya 'vr&h 'mi-zi-ya) is the 604 m summit of Vidin Heights on Varna Peninsula, eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Nesebar Gap (Sedlovina Nesebar se-dlo-vi-'na ne-'se-b&r) is a 1.3 km wide gap in eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] bounded to the west by Pliska Ridge and to the east by the northern slope of Mount Friesland, Tangra Mountains.

Nestinari Nunataks (Nestinarski Nunatatsi e-sti-'nar-ski 'nu-na-ta-tsi) are a pair of rocky peaks of elevation 470 m and 520 m in middle Huron Glacier, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Nikopol Point (Nos Nikopol 'nos ni-'ko-pol) is a snow-free point on the south coast of Byers Peninsula, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] projecting 650 m east-southeastwards into Bransfield Strait and linked by a spit to Vietor Rock to the south.
Ogosta Point (Nos Ogosta 'nos o-'gos-ta) is located in the central part of Zagore Beach on the east coast of False Bay, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Omurtag Pass (Omurtagov Prohod o-mur-'ta-gov 'pro-hod) is a 720 m high pass between Mount Bowles and Ticha Peak in Bowles Ridge, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] and is part of an overland route between the Wörner Gap area and upper Kaliakra Glacier.

Oryahovo Heights (Oryahovski Vazvisheniya o-'rya-hov-ski v&-zvi-'she-ni-ya) are the ice-covered heights of elevation 340 m extending 6 km in north-south direction in central and eastern Ioannes Paulus II Peninsula, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Osogovo Bay (Osogovski Zaliv o-so-'gov-ski 'za-liv), "named after the Osogovo region in western Bulgaria", is bounded by the south coast of Rugged Island, by Astor Island, and by the west coast of the Byers Peninsula south of Laager Point, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Orpheus Gate (Orfeeva Porta or-'fe-e-va 'por-ta) is a 548 m high, 380 m wide, pass in eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] bounded by Pliska Ridge to the southeast and Burdick Ridge to the northwest, Huntress Glacier to the southwest and Perunika Glacier to the northeast.

Paisiy Peak (Vrah Paisiy 'vr&h pa-'i-siy) rises to approximately 550 m in the Delchev Ridge, Tangra Mountains, eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] surmounting Sopot Ice Piedmont to the north and east.
Passy Peak (Vrah Passy 'vr&h pa-'si) is a peak of elevation 510 m in Vidin Heights on Varna Peninsula, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Pautalia Glacier (Lednik Pautaliya 'led-nik pa-u-'ta-li-ya) is a small glacier on Burgas Peninsula, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] situated northeast of Strandzha Glacier and south of Sopot Ice Piedmont.

Panega Glacier (Lednik Panega 'led-nik 'pa-ne-ga) on Varna Peninsula, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] is situated southeast of the northeastern portion of Saedinenie Snowfield, south of Rose Valley Glacier, southwest of Debelt Glacier and north of lower Kaliakra Glacier.
Perperek Knoll (Perperekska Mogila per-pe-'rek-ska mo-'gi-la) is a 360 m peak in Vidin Heights on Varna Peninsula, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Perunika Glacier (Lednik Perunika 'led-nik pe-ru-'ni-ka) is an 8 km long and 3 km wide (average) roughly crescent-shaped glacier in eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] situated east of Pimpirev Glacier, south of Saedinenie Snowfield, southwest of Kaliakra Glacier, west of Huron Glacier, and north of Balkan Snowfield and the head of Huntress Glacier.

The Peshtera Glacier (Bulgarian Lednik Peshtera) is a glacier on the Rozhen Peninsula, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] situated southwest of Ruen Icefall and north of Charity Glacier.

Petrich Peak (Vrah Petrich 'vr&h 'pet-rich) is an ice-covered peak of elevation 760 m in central Bowles Ridge on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK], which is named after the town of Petrich in Southwestern Bulgaria.
Pirdop Gate (Pirdopska Porta pir-'dop-ska 'por-ta) is a 300-m wide pass between Maritsa Peak and Atanasoff Nunatak in eastern Bowles Ridge, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Plovdiv Peak (Vrah Plovdiv 'vr&h 'plov-div) is a peak rising to 1,040 m in the east extremity of Levski Ridge, Tangra Mountains, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].
Pliska Ridge (Vrah Pliska 'vr&h 'pli-ska) is a three-peaked ridge rising to 667 m in eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Petko Voyvoda Peak (Vrah Petko Voyvoda 'vr&h 'pet-ko voy-'vo-da) is a partly ice-covered peak of elevation 400 m in Delchev Ridge in Tangra Mountains, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK], which surmounts Sopot Ice Piedmont to the northwest, and Pautalia Glacier to the east.

Pleven Saddle (Plevenska Sedlovina 'ple-ven-ska se-dlo-vi-'na) is a deep saddle of elevation 500 m in Friesland Ridge, Tangra Mountains, Livingston Island, [MASK], bounded by MacKay Peak to the west-southwest and Tervel Peak to the east-northeast, with two conspicuous rocks rising on it.

Pomorie Point (Nos Pomorie 'nos po-'mo-ri-e) is a point on the coast of McFarlane Strait forming the north side of the entrance to Lister Cove, Varna Peninsula, Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Pimpirev Glacier (Pimpirev Lednik pim-'pi-rev 'led-nik) on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] is situated south of the glacial divide between the Drake Passage and Bransfield Strait, southeast of Tundzha Glacier, southwest of Saedinenie Snowfield, west of Perunika Glacier and east-northeast of Kamchiya Glacier.

The 500 metres (1,600 ft) long melt-water stream draining that portion of the northwestern slope of Balkan Snowfield located between Hesperides Hill, Atlantic Club Ridge, Krum Rock and Sinemorets Hill on Hurd Peninsula in eastern Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands in [MASK].

Yambol Peak (Vrah Yambol 'vr&h 'yam-bol) is a rocky peak rising to 300 m in the south extremity of Friesland Ridge, Tangra Mountains on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] and overlooking Tarnovo Ice Piedmont to the west and Prespa Glacier to the northeast.

Camp Academia (Lager Akademiya 'la-ger a-ka-'de-mi-ya) is a geographical locality in eastern Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands, [MASK], named for the Bulgarian Academy of Sciences in appreciation of Academy’s contribution to the Antarctic exploration.

Camp Academia (Lager Akademiya 'la-ger a-ka-'de-mi-ya) is a geographical locality in eastern Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands, Antarctica, named for the Bulgarian Academy of Sciences in appreciation of Academy’s contribution to the [MASK] exploration.

Botev Peak (Botev Vrah 'bo-tev 'vr&h) is a peak rising to about 370 m in the southern extremity of the Veleka Ridge of Tangra Mountains, eastern Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] overlooking Tarnovo Ice Piedmont to the east-northeast, Botev Point to the south, Barnard Point to the west and Arkutino Beach to the northwest.

Berkovitsa Glacier (Lednik Berkovitsa 'led-nik ber-'ko-vi-tsa) is a glacier on Livingston Island, [MASK] situated east of Etar Snowfield, south of Medven Glacier, west-northwest of Tundzha Glacier and north-northeast of Verila Glacier.
Belozem Hill (Halm Belozem 'h&lm be-lo-'zem) is the northeasternmost of a chain of hills along Bulgarian Beach on Hurd Peninsula in the east of Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands in [MASK].

Smyadovo Cove (Bulgarian: залив Смядово, ‘Zaliv Smyadovo’ 'za-liv 'smya-do-vo) is a 900 m wide cove indenting for 850 m the west coast of Rugged Island off the west coast of Byers Peninsula of Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Timok Cove (Bulgarian: залив Тимок, ‘Zaliv Timok’ 'za-liv 'ti-mok) is a 580 m wide cove indenting for 400 m the north coast of Rugged Island off the west coast of Byers Peninsula of Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK], and entered west of Simitli Point.

Vineh Peak (Bulgarian: връх Винех, ‘Vrah Vineh’ 'vr&h vi-'neh) is a rocky peak rising to 186 m in the east extremity of Rugged Island off the west coast of Byers Peninsula of Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Bakshev Ridge (Bulgarian: Бакшев рид, ‘Bakshev Rid’ 'bak-shev 'rid) is a rugged rocky ridge on Rugged Island off the west coast of Byers Peninsula of Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] extending 700 m in southeast-northwest direction, with a highest point of elevation 239 m situated 660 m east of San Stefano Peak, 1.25 km west of Vund Point, and 1.1 km northwest of Radev Point.

Mostich Hill (Bulgarian: хълм Мостич, ‘Halm Mostich’ 'h&lm 'mos-tich) is a rocky hill rising to 130 m in the southwestern part of Rugged Island off the west coast of Byers Peninsula of Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK].

Remetalk Point on Livingston Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] is named after him.

Vardim Rocks at Hell Gates in Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands in [MASK] are named after Vardim Island and the adjacent settlement of Vardim.

His [MASK] ascents include Mount Vinson, Mount Shinn, Mount Craddock, Mount Gardner, Mount Bentley, Mount Anderson (first ascent) and several other peaks in Vinson Massif, Craddock Massif and northern Sentinel Range in 2001–2007, as well as Mount Friesland and Mount Bowles on Livingston Island in 2003.

Livingston Island (historical Russian name Smolensk, 62°36′S60°30′W﻿ / ﻿62.600°S 60.500°W) is an [MASK] island in the South Shetland Islands, Western Antarctica lying between Greenwich Island and Snow Islands.

Grim Rock (65°23′S64°29′W﻿ / ﻿65.383°S 64.483°W) is a rock awash 3 nautical miles (6 km) south-southeast of the Gedges Rocks and 10 nautical miles (19 km) west-northwest of Cape Perez, lying in Grandidier Channel off the west coast of Graham Land, [MASK].

It was mapped by the Falkland Islands Dependencies Survey (FIDS) from photos taken by Hunting Aerosurveys Ltd. in 1956-57, and was named by the United Kingdom [MASK] Place-Names Committee (UK-APC) because the rocks lie on the edge of Grandidier Channel.

Larrouy Island (65°52′S65°15′W﻿ / ﻿65.867°S 65.250°W) is an island 5 nautical miles (9 km) long and 2 nautical miles (4 km) wide which rises to 745 metres (2,440 ft), (the Peak Pilot) lying in Grandidier Channel off the northwest coast of Velingrad Peninsula 4 nautical miles (7 km) north of Ferin Head, [MASK].

Bizone Rock (Bulgarian: скала Бизоне, ‘Skala Bizone’ 'ska-la bi-'zo-ne) is the rock off Snow Island in the South Shetland Islands, [MASK] extending 120 m in southeast-northwest direction and 100 m wide.
It was named by the Advisory Committee on [MASK] Names for Lieutenant Commander Winston R. Hayes, U.S. Navy Reserve, the pilot on that flight.
Hayes Glacier in [MASK] enters the southeast part of the Weddell Sea about 17 miles (27 km) west-southwest of Dawson-Lambton Glacier.
Remapped by ANARE (Australian National [MASK] Research Expeditions) (1957–58) and named for P.B.

It was charted in 1940 by the United States [MASK] Service (USAS) and erroneously called Cape Rymill at that time.
Flårjuven Bluff (72°2′S3°24′W﻿ / ﻿72.033°S 3.400°W) is a flat-topped, largely ice-free bluff about 1 nautical mile (2 km) north of Storkletten Peak, on the Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
The Flårjuvnutane Peaks (72°1′S3°32′W﻿ / ﻿72.017°S 3.533°W) are a group of small rock peaks about 1 nautical mile (2 km) west of Flårjuven Bluff, on the Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
The Gösta Peaks (72°6′S2°44′W﻿ / ﻿72.100°S 2.733°W) are the northeastern peaks of the Liljequist Heights, in the southern part of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].

Gråsteinen Nunatak (71°57′S2°0′W﻿ / ﻿71.950°S 2.000°W) is an isolated nunatak 7 nautical miles (13 km) southwest of the Litvillingane Rocks, on the east side of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].

Lorentzen Peak (71°45′S2°50′W﻿ / ﻿71.750°S 2.833°W) is a peak 5 nautical miles (9 km) south of Vesleskarvet Cliff and 6 nautical miles (11 km) west of Tommeliten Rock, on the west side of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].

The Litvillingane Rocks (71°52′S1°44′W﻿ / ﻿71.867°S 1.733°W) are two isolated nunataks, the eastern with a small outlier, lying 3 nautical miles (6 km) south of Bolten Peak, on the east side of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
Marsteinen Nunatak (71°26′S1°42′W﻿ / ﻿71.433°S 1.700°W) is a coastal nunatak 6 nautical miles (11 km) northeast of Valken Hill, at the north end of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
The Klumpane Peaks are a group of small rock peaks on the east side of the mouth of Strengen Valley, on the Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].

The Kjølrabbane Hills (72°16′S3°22′W﻿ / ﻿72.267°S 3.367°W) are a small group of hills between Lyftingen Peak and the Styrbordsknattane Peaks, near the southwest end of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].

Jekselen Peak (72°0′S2°33′W﻿ / ﻿72.000°S 2.550°W) is, at 1,405 metres (4,610 ft), the highest peak in a small ridge 7 nautical miles (13 km) east-southeast of Mount Schumacher, in the Ahlmann Ridge of Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
Krylen Hill (71°33′S2°10′W﻿ / ﻿71.550°S 2.167°W) is a hill 5 nautical miles (9 km) southwest of Valken Hill, in the northern part of the Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
Kullen Knoll (72°4′S2°44′W﻿ / ﻿72.067°S 2.733°W) is a knoll 2 nautical miles (4 km) north of the Gösta Peaks, in the south part of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
Knotten Nunatak (71°37′S2°19′W﻿ / ﻿71.617°S 2.317°W) is a nunatak 5 nautical miles (9 km) southwest of Krylen Hill, in the northern part of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
Knerten Rock (71°33′S2°52′W﻿ / ﻿71.550°S 2.867°W) is a small isolated rock 7 nautical miles (13 km) north of Vesleskarvet Cliff, in the northwest part of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
Storkletten Peak (72°3′S3°25′W﻿ / ﻿72.050°S 3.417°W) is an ice-free mountain 1 nautical mile (1.9 km) south of Flarjuven Bluff, on the Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].

Strengen Valley (72°0′S3°28′W﻿ / ﻿72.000°S 3.467°W) is an ice-filled valley, about 4 nautical miles (7 km) long, between Flarjuvnutane Peaks and Flarjuven Bluff on the west side of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK] (claimed as a dependency of Norway).
The Grunehogna Peaks (72°3′S2°47′W﻿ / ﻿72.050°S 2.783°W) are a group of peaks 2 nautical miles (4 km) north of the Liljequist Heights, in the south part of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].

Jutulstraumen Glacier is a large glacier in Queen Maud Land, [MASK], about 120 nautical miles (220 km) long, draining northward to the Fimbul Ice Shelf between the Kirwan Escarpment, Borg Massif and Ahlmann Ridge on the west and the Sverdrup Mountains on the east.
Hornet Peak (72°12′S2°59′W﻿ / ﻿72.200°S 2.983°W) is a sharp peak 3 nautical miles (6 km) west of Snøhetta Dome, near the south end of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
Tommeliten Rock (71°47′S2°29′W﻿ / ﻿71.783°S 2.483°W) is an isolated nunatak (a glacial island) 6 nautical miles (11 km) east of Lorentzen Peak on the Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
Lyftingen Peak (72°17′S3°15′W﻿ / ﻿72.283°S 3.250°W) is a peak just southeast of the Kjølrabbane Hills, near the southwest end of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
The Liljequist Heights (72°6′S2°48′W﻿ / ﻿72.100°S 2.800°W) are the heights about 2 nautical miles (4 km) south of the Grunehogna Peaks, in the Ahlmann Ridge of Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
Vesleskarvet is a nunatak on the west side of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
Istind Peak (72°6′S2°23′W﻿ / ﻿72.100°S 2.383°W) is a partly ice-covered peak 1 mile (1.6 km) south of Tindeklypa, on the east side of Ahlmann Ridge in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
Istindhalsen Saddle is an ice saddle between Istind Peak and the Grunehogna Peaks in the Ahlmann Ridge of Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
The Stein Nunataks and Witte Peaks, named by the German [MASK] Expedition, appear to coincide with the northeast part of the Ahlmann Ridge.
The feature was mapped in detail from surveys and air photos by the Norwegian-British-Swedish [MASK] Expedition (NBSAE) (1949–1952) and air photos by the Norwegian expedition (1958–59).

Tuorda Peak (65°59′S65°10′W﻿ / ﻿65.983°S 65.167°W) is a peak, 870 m, rising eastward of Ferin Head on Velingrad Peninsula, the west coast of Graham Land, [MASK].
Named by the United Kingdom [MASK] Place-Names Committee (UK-APC) in 1959 for Pava L. Tuorda, a Jokkmokk Lapp who, with Anders Rossa, accompanied A.E.

Louis Philippe Plateau (63°36′S58°21′W﻿ / ﻿63.600°S 58.350°W) is a plateau, about 11 nautical miles (20 km) long and 5 nautical miles (9 km) wide, which rises to 1,370 metres (4,500 ft) and occupies the central part of Trinity Peninsula, [MASK], between Russell West Glacier and Windy Gap.

Kukuryak Bluff (Bulgarian: връх Кукуряк, ‘Vrah Kukuryak’ 'vr&h ku-ku-'ryak) is the partly ice-free bluff rising to over 700 m at the end of a ridge descending eastwards from Louis-Philippe Plateau on Trinity Peninsula in Graham Land, [MASK].

Hochstetter Peak (Bulgarian: връх Хохщетер, ‘Vrah Hochstetter’ 'vr&h 'hoh-shte-ter) is the partly ice-free bluff rising to over 1000 m in the southeast foothills of Louis-Philippe Plateau on Trinity Peninsula in Graham Land, [MASK].
Smin Peak (Bulgarian: връх Смин, ‘Vrah Smin’ 'vr&h 'smin) is the partly ice-free peak rising to 850 m in the southeast foothills of Louis-Philippe Plateau on Trinity Peninsula in Graham Land, [MASK].

Konush Hill (Bulgarian: Конушки хълм, ‘Konushki Halm’ 'ko-nush-ki 'h&lm) is the ice-covered hill rising to 550 m in the north foothills of Louis-Philippe Plateau on Trinity Peninsula in Graham Land, [MASK].

Tintyava Peak (Bulgarian: връх Тинтява, ‘Vrah Tintyava’ 'vr&h tin'tya-va) is the ice-covered peak rising to 950 m in the north foothills of Louis-Philippe Plateau on Trinity Peninsula in Graham Land, [MASK].
Mount D’Urville is the ice-covered peak rising to 1085 m in the north foothills of Louis-Philippe Plateau on Trinity Peninsula in Graham Land, [MASK].

Ogled Peak (Bulgarian: връх Оглед, ‘Vrah Ogled’ 'vr&h 'o-gled) is the ice-covered peak rising to over 700 m in the north foothills of Louis-Philippe Plateau on Trinity Peninsula in Graham Land, [MASK].

Snegotin Ridge (Bulgarian: Снеготински рид, ‘Snegotinski Rid’ 'sne-go-tin-ski 'rid) is the ice-covered ridge rising to over 1200 m on the northwest side of Louis-Philippe Plateau on Trinity Peninsula in Graham Land, [MASK].

Huhla Col (Bulgarian: седловина Хухла, ‘Sedlovina Huhla’ se-dlo-vi-'na 'huh-la) is the ice-covered col of elevation over 900 m on Trinity Peninsula in Graham Land, [MASK], which is linking Snegotin Ridge to the north to the west part of Louis-Philippe Plateau to the south.

Prelez Gap (Bulgarian: седловина Прелез, ‘Sedlovina Prelez’ se-dlo-vi-'na 'pre-lez) is the flat ice-covered saddle of elevation over 700 m on Trinity Peninsula in Graham Land, [MASK], which is linking Marescot Ridge to the northwest to Louis-Philippe Plateau to the southeast.

Lambuh Knoll (Bulgarian: Ламбухска могила, ‘Lambuhska Mogila’ 'lam-buh-ska mo-'gi-la) is the ice-covered hill rising to over 900 m at the north entrance to Trajan Gate between Louis-Philippe Plateau and Srednogorie Heights on Trinity Peninsula in Graham Land, [MASK].

Drenta Bluff (Bulgarian: връх Дрента, ‘Vrah Drenta’ 'vr&h 'dren-ta) is the ice-covered bluff of elevation 1076 m forming the south extremity of Louis-Philippe Plateau on Trinity Peninsula in Graham Land, [MASK].

The point, the site of an Adélie penguin rookery, was charted by personnel of the USS Glacier on February 4, 1962, and was named by the Advisory Committee on [MASK] Names for Lieutenant David S. Mathewson, U.S. Navy, then supply officer of the Glacier.
Mathewson Point (74°23′S132°33′W﻿ / ﻿74.383°S 132.550°W) is a steep, rocky point at the northern tip of Shepard Island, which lies on the seaward edge of the Getz Ice Shelf, Marie Byrd Land, [MASK].

Kjelbotn Peak (72°14′S26°34′E﻿ / ﻿72.233°S 26.567°E) is a peak, 3,210 metres (10,530 ft) high, standing between Isachsen Mountain and Devold Peak in the Sør Rondane Mountains of [MASK].

Biscoe Point is a rocky point forming the south-eastern side of Biscoe Bay, immediately north of Access Point on the south side of Anvers Island, in the Palmer Archipelago of [MASK].
Eaton Nunatak (75°10′S72°0′W﻿ / ﻿75.167°S 72.000°W) is a prominent nunatak marking the southeastern extremity of the Merrick Mountains, in Palmer Land, [MASK].

It was mapped by the United States Geological Survey from surveys and from U.S. Navy air photos, 1961–67, and was named by the Advisory Committee on [MASK] Names for John W. Eaton, an aurora scientist at Eights Station in 1963.
Slumkey Island (65°30′S65°28′W﻿ / ﻿65.500°S 65.467°W) is a largest island of the group lying east of Tupman Island, Pitt Islands, in the Biscoe Islands, [MASK].

The Amiot Islands are two groups of islands and rocks, the Ward Islands and Cumbers Reef, respectively, lying 17 kilometres (9 nmi) west of Cape Adriasola, Adelaide Island, [MASK].

The Hellerman Rocks (64°48′S64°1′W﻿ / ﻿64.800°S 64.017°W) are a group of seven small islets and rocks connected by a shoal, located 0.4 nautical miles (0.7 km) east of Hermit Island, off the southwest coast of Anvers Island, [MASK].
It was named by the Advisory Committee on [MASK] Names for Lieutenant Lance W. Hellerman of the U.S. Navy Reserve, Officer-in-Charge of Palmer Station in 1969.
Biscoe Bay is a bay which indents the southwest coast of Anvers Island immediately north of Biscoe Point, in the Palmer Archipelago, [MASK].

The rocks were surveyed by the British Naval Hydrographic Survey Unit in 1956-57 and named by the United Kingdom [MASK] Place-Names Committee (UK-APC) for Able Seaman John Walsham, Royal Navy, a member of the Unit.
Walsham Rocks is a group of rocks lying 1 nautical mile (1.9 km) east of Buff island, at the southwest end of the Palmer Archipelago, off the coast of [MASK].
It was delineated from aerial photos taken by U.S. Navy Operation Highjump (1946–47), and named by the Advisory Committee on [MASK] Names for Lieutenant (j.g.)

Mount Brown (68°18′S86°25′E﻿ / ﻿68.300°S 86.417°E) is an elongated rock peak protruding slightly above the continental ice, situated 160 miles (260 km) east of the Vestfold Hills and 100 miles (160 km) south-southwest of Cape Penck in [MASK].
Mount Goldring (66°57′S66°1′W﻿ / ﻿66.950°S 66.017°W) is a peak on Pernik Peninsula, Loubet Coast, situated on the north side of Murphy Glacier, to the east of Lallemand Fjord in Graham Land, [MASK].
The Mist Rocks (66°48′S66°37′W﻿ / ﻿66.800°S 66.617°W) are a group of insular rocks close northwest of Holdfast Point at the entrance to Lallemand Fjord, Graham Land, [MASK].

The Kinzl Crests (67°5′S66°18′W﻿ / ﻿67.083°S 66.300°W) are three peaks, 2,135 metres (7,000 ft) high, on Pernik Peninsula, Loubet Coast in Graham Land, [MASK], standing 3 nautical miles (6 km) east of Salmon Cove and Lallemand Fjord.

McCall Point (67°2′S66°38′W﻿ / ﻿67.033°S 66.633°W) is a point on the east side of Lallemand Fjord, 4 nautical miles (7 km) northwest of Salmon Cove on the west coast of Pernik Peninsula, on the Loubet Coast of Graham Land, [MASK].

The Lallemand Fjord (67°06′S66°42′W﻿ / ﻿67.100°S 66.700°W) is a fjord located east of Arrowsmith Peninsula and west of Pernik Peninsula on Loubet Coast on the western side of the Antarctic Peninsula, [MASK].

The Lallemand Fjord (67°06′S66°42′W﻿ / ﻿67.100°S 66.700°W) is a fjord located east of Arrowsmith Peninsula and west of Pernik Peninsula on Loubet Coast on the western side of the [MASK] Peninsula, Antarctica.

The Lallemand Fjord (67°06′S66°42′W﻿ / ﻿67.100°S 66.700°W) is a fjord located east of Arrowsmith Peninsula and west of Pernik Peninsula on Loubet Coast on the western side of the Antarctic Peninsula, [MASK].

Holdfast Point (66°48′S66°36′W﻿ / ﻿66.800°S 66.600°W) is both the northeast side of the entrance to Lallemand Fjord and the northwest side of the entrance to Chepra Cove on Pernik Peninsula in Graham Land, [MASK], situated about 12 nautical miles (22 km) southwest of Cape Rey.
Hooke Point (67°11′S66°42′W﻿ / ﻿67.183°S 66.700°W) is a point near the head of Lallemand Fjord, in Graham Land, [MASK].
Hoodwink Island is an island lying 2 kilometres (1 nmi) east of Arrowsmith Peninsula in Lallemand Fjord, Graham Land, [MASK].

Haefeli Glacier (67°18′S66°23′W﻿ / ﻿67.300°S 66.383°W) is a glacier, 2 miles (3 km) wide and 6 miles (10 km) long, situated on Pernik Peninsula, Loubet Coast in Graham Land, [MASK], at the northwest side of Finsterwalder Glacier and flowing south-southwest toward the head of Lallemand Fjord.

Finsterwalder Glacier (67°19′S66°20′W﻿ / ﻿67.317°S 66.333°W) is a glacier, 2 miles (3 km) wide and 10 miles (16 km) long, flowing southwest from the central plateau of Graham Land, [MASK], toward the head of Lallemand Fjord.
Hertha Nunatak (65°9′S59°59′W﻿ / ﻿65.150°S 59.983°W) is a nunatak 1 nautical mile (2 km) northwest of Castor Nunatak in the Seal Nunataks group, off the east coast of the [MASK] Peninsula.
Named by the New Zealand [MASK] Place-Names Committee (NZ-APC) in 1982 from a proposal by G.G.C.
Mae-hyōga Rock (70°0′S38°54′E﻿ / ﻿70.000°S 38.900°E) is an exposed rock lying 3 nautical miles (6 km) northwest of Oku-hyōga Rock on the east side of Shirase Glacier, in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].
It was mapped from surveys and air photos by the Japanese [MASK] Research Expedition, 1957–62, and was named Mae-hyoga-iwa (outer glacier rock) in association with nearby Oku-hyōga Rock.

Mount Harvey (66°55′S50°48′E﻿ / ﻿66.917°S 50.800°E) is a snow-free peak east of Amundsen Bay, standing in the Tula Mountains of [MASK], about 6 nautical miles (11 km) east-northeast of Mount Gleadell.
Melania Ridge (78°9′S166°17′E﻿ / ﻿78.150°S 166.283°E) is a basalt ridge running southeast for 3 nautical miles (6 km) from Mount Melania, on Black Island in the Ross Archipelago, [MASK].
Mount Hayward (78°7′S167°21′E﻿ / ﻿78.117°S 167.350°E) is a hill 2 nautical miles (4 km) southwest of Mount Heine on White Island, in the Ross Archipelago, [MASK].
Mount Heine is a hill, 760 metres (2,490 ft) high, in the northern part of White Island, in the Ross Archipelago, [MASK].
Cape Hodgson (78°7′S166°5′E﻿ / ﻿78.117°S 166.083°E) is the northernmost cape of Black Island, in the Ross Archipelago, [MASK].

The Lopez de Bertodano Formation is a geological formation in the James Ross archipelago of the [MASK] Peninsula.
Jungk Hill (78°12′S166°26′E﻿ / ﻿78.200°S 166.433°E) is a mostly ice-free hill 1.7 nautical miles (3 km) northeast of Mount Aurora on Black Island, in the Ross Archipelago of [MASK].

So named by the New Zealand Geological Survey [MASK] Expedition (NZGSAE) (1958–59) because of the magnificent view obtained of the peaks in this vicinity and of the Ross Archipelago and Minna Bluff area.

The North-west White Island [MASK] Specially Protected Area comprises a 142 km2 area of coastal shelf ice on the north-west side of White Island in the Ross Archipelago of Antarctica.The site has been designated an Antarctic Specially Protected Area (ASPA 137) because it supports an unusual small breeding population of Weddell seals, which is not only the most southerly known, but which has also been physically isolated from other populations by the advance of the McMurdo and Ross ice shelves.

Isolation Point (78°11′S167°30′E﻿ / ﻿78.183°S 167.500°E) is a small volcanic peak projecting through the ice sheet covering the southeastern extremity of White Island, in the Ross Archipelago, [MASK].

Mount Helms (82°4′S87°58′W﻿ / ﻿82.067°S 87.967°W) is a rounded, partly snow-covered peak rising between Mount Semprebon and Mount Oldenburg in the central Martin Hills of [MASK].

Mason Nunatak (79°39′S155°15′E﻿ / ﻿79.650°S 155.250°E) is a nunatak 1 nautical mile (2 km) long at the northwest end of the Meteorite Hills and the Darwin Mountains of [MASK].

Pesce Peninsula (71°41′S74°57′W﻿ / ﻿71.683°S 74.950°W) is a broad snow-covered peninsula lying between Rameau Inlet and Verdi Inlet on the north side of the Beethoven Peninsula, situated in the southwest portion of Alexander Island, [MASK].

Dykeman Point (71°33′S75°8′W﻿ / ﻿71.550°S 75.133°W) is a snow-covered point between Rameau Inlet and Verdi Inlet, marking the northwestern extremity of Pesce Peninsula on the Beethoven Peninsula, southwest Alexander Island, [MASK].

Harris Peninsula (71°31′S74°6′W﻿ / ﻿71.517°S 74.100°W) is a broad snow-covered peninsula surmounted by Mount Lee, between Verdi Inlet and Brahms Inlet on the north side of the Beethoven Peninsula, located in the southwest portion of Alexander Island, [MASK].

Radigan Point (71°23′S74°16′W﻿ / ﻿71.383°S 74.267°W) is a snow-covered headland lying between Verdi Inlet and Brahms Inlet, marking the north extremity of the Harris Peninsula, a minor peninsula protrudes northward from the Beethoven Peninsula, situated in the southwest portion of Alexander Island, [MASK].

Verdi Inlet (71°36′S74°30′W﻿ / ﻿71.600°S 74.500°W) is an ice-filled inlet lying between Pesce Peninsula and Harris Peninsula, on the north side of the Beethoven Peninsula, situated in the southwest portion of Alexander Island, [MASK].

Verdi Inlet (71°36′S74°30′W﻿ / ﻿71.600°S 74.500°W) is an ice-filled inlet lying between Pesce Peninsula and Harris Peninsula, on the north side of the Beethoven Peninsula, situated in the southwest portion of Alexander Island, [MASK].

Radigan Point (71°23′S74°16′W﻿ / ﻿71.383°S 74.267°W) is a snow-covered headland lying between Verdi Inlet and Brahms Inlet, marking the north extremity of the Harris Peninsula, a minor peninsula protrudes northward from the Beethoven Peninsula, situated in the southwest portion of Alexander Island, [MASK].

Holzrichter Glacier (84°50′S172°30′W﻿ / ﻿84.833°S 172.500°W) is a broad tributary glacier which drains the northeastern slopes of the Prince Olav Mountains of [MASK] between Mount Wade and Mount Oliver and enters Gough Glacier just north of Mount Dodge.

Goodenough Glacier (72°0′S66°40′W﻿ / ﻿72.000°S 66.667°W) is a broad sweeping glacier to the south of the Batterbee Mountains, flowing from the west shore of Palmer Land, [MASK], into George VI Sound and the George VI Ice Shelf.

Troll Satellite Station (Norwegian: Troll satelittstasjon), commonly abbreviated TrollSat, is a satellite ground station located at Troll in Queen Maud Land, [MASK].

In addition to hosting its own antennas serving thirty satellites, TSS acts as the center-point of KSAT's operations and provides backbone services for the high Arctic Svalbard Satellite Station (SvalSat) and the [MASK] Troll Satellite Station (TrollSat).
SvalSat and KSAT's Troll Satellite Station (TrollSat) in [MASK] are the only ground stations able to download information for all 14 orbits of polar orbiting satellites.

It was mapped by the United States Geological Survey from surveys and from U.S. Navy air photos, 1959–66, and named by the Advisory Committee on [MASK] Names for Alvin C. Boeger, Chief Aerographer's Mate, U.S. Navy.

Ferrar Glacier is a glacier in [MASK].
The glacier was discovered by the British National [MASK] Expedition (1901–04) and at that time thought to be a part of Ferrar Glacier.

The Western Journey Party of the British [MASK] Expedition 1910 determined that the upper and lower portions of what was then known as Ferrar Glacier are apposed, i.e., joined in Siamese-twin fashion north of Knobhead.

evidences.sub_surface: North-west White Island Antarctic Specially Protected Area
evidences.masked_sentence: The North-west White Island [MASK] Specially Protected Area comprises a 142 km2 area of coastal shelf ice on the north-west side of White Island in the Ross Archipelago of Antarctica.The site has been designated an Antarctic Specially Protected Area (ASPA 137) because it supports an unusual small breeding population of Weddell seals, which is not only the most southerly known, but which has also been physically isolated from other populations by the advance of the McMurdo and Ross ice shelves.
